title: 113_hr1589
content: The "Small Farm Insurance Act of 2013" may be cited as the short title. It includes provisions for the Noninsured Crop Assistance Program. Section 196 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 is amended to establish a noninsured crop disaster assistance program for eligible crops, providing coverage based on individual yields equivalent to catastrophic risk protection under the Federal Crop Insurance Act. The Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 is amended to establish a noninsured crop disaster assistance program through the Farm Service Agency, providing coverage up to 65 percent under specific sections of the Act. The Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 is amended to establish a noninsured crop disaster assistance program through the Farm Service Agency, providing coverage up to 65 percent under specific sections of the Act. Payment equivalent to additional coverage is available to eligible producers under subsection (l) of the Act. The noninsured crop disaster assistance program provides payments based on a percentage of the established yield, market price, and a payment rate determined by the Secretary for different crop types. The noninsured crop disaster assistance program provides payments based on established yield, market price, and a payment rate determined by the Secretary for different crop types. To be eligible for a payment, a producer must pay a service fee and a premium for the applicable crop year. The noninsured crop disaster assistance program provides payments based on established yield, market price, and coverage level elected by the producer. Limited resource, beginning, and socially disadvantaged farmers can access additional coverage at a reduced premium. The noninsured crop disaster assistance program allows producers to elect additional coverage at a reduced premium. Producers must pay the premium by September 30 of the crop year and the latest application deadline is the closing date described in subsection (b)(1). Additional coverage under this subsection is available starting from the 2014 crop.
